name: shouldDeployPluginImageWithPostgresql()
description: Should deploy a custom Plugin image with a PostgreSQL database
descriptionHtml: Should deploy a custom Plugin image with a PostgreSQL database

testStage.description: Should deploy a custom Plugin image with a PostgreSQL database

steps.name: Given that the Operator runs in a Kubernetes environment the requires a filesystem user/group override for mounted volumes
And the routing suffix has been configured globally
And a TLS Secret was created and configured as default
And there is a controller to process requests for the DBMS capability
And there is a controller to process requests for the SSO capability
When I create an EntandoPlugin with minimal configuration
Then the Plugin deployment completed successfully
Then a PostgreSQL DBMS Capability was provided :
Then a Red Hat SSO Capability was provided
And a database schema was prepared for the Entando Plugin
with the DB Admin credentials from the secret default-postgresql-dbms-in-namespace-admin-secret
with the DB Schema credentials from the secret my-plugin-plugindb-secret
And a Kubernetes Deployment was created reflecting the requirements of a typical Plugin container:
With a volume mounted to the standard directory /entando-data
Which is bound to a PersistentVolumeClain
And the File System User/Group override 185has been applied to the mount
And all the variables required to connect to Red Hat SSO have been configured
And a Kubernetes Service was created for the plugin deployment
And with a label selector matching the labels of the Pod Template on the  Deployment
And a Kubernetes Ingress was created:
With a hostname derived from the Plugin name, namespace and the routing suffix
And the path '/my-plugin' is mapped to the service 'my-plugin-service'
And with TLS configured to use the default TLS secret
And the default TLS secret was cloned into the EntandoPlugin's deployment namespace
Resulting state changes in the Kubernetes cluster

labels.name: feature
labels.value: As a deployer, I would like to deploy an EntandoPlugin directly so that I have more granular control over the configuration settings
